com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Class BaseTextSymbol

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseSymbol
        |
        +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseFontSymbol
              |
              +--com.esri.mo2.map.draw.BaseTextSymbol
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, Symbol, TextSymbol
Direct Known Subclasses:
CalloutMarkerSymbol, ChartSymbol, RasterShieldSymbol, SimpleShieldSymbol, SimpleTextSymbol, TextMarkerSymbol
public abstract class BaseTextSymbol
extends BaseFontSymbol
implements TextSymbol

This basic implementation of a TextSymbol provides support for various appearance properties.

setRotationalAngles

public void setRotationalAngles(String stringAngles)
The method sets the list of the rotational angles. The rotational angles are possible angles that the label can be places relative to the labeled point. By default, only an angle of 0 degrees will be used to label the point. If a comma-delimited list of rotational angles is given, then the points, if needed, will also be labeled using that angle.

Specified by:
setRotationalAngles in interface TextSymbol
Parameters:
stringAngles - the string like "15,75,105,165". Up to 8 integer angles can be specified.
See Also:
TextSymbol.setRotationalAngles(java.lang.String)

draw

public void draw(FeatureGeometry g,
                 Graphics2D g2,
                 Object values)
This method is ignored since a TextSymbol is never used to directly draw Geometry.

Specified by:
draw in interface Symbol
Parameters:
g - the Geometry
g2 - the graphics context for rendering
values - the values of attribute fields, null == is ok and means no field values
Throws:
RuntimeException - if any code tries to call this method
See Also:
Symbol.draw(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.FeatureGeometry, java.awt.Graphics2D, java.lang.Object)
